## GAD-7 vs MAST

GAD-7 vs MAST: A Harmonious Comparison Researchers and psychologists often require a detailed comparison between different questionnaires. The Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7), a tool used to evaluate the severity of generalized anxiety disorder, is often compared with the Michigan Alcoholism Screening Test (MAST). The purpose of comparing GAD-7 vs MAST is to harmoniously synergize the aspects of both these tests, for a more comprehensive psychological discussion. The process of comparing and harmonising GAD-7 vs MAST can be a time-consuming and subjective ordeal. However, by using Harmony, an advanced software for psychologists, the process becomes simpler. Harmony uses natural language processing and generative AI models to compare questionnaire items even in different languages. Through its use, psychologists can get a detailed percentage match between each item in GAD-7 and MAST, thus saving time and resources while ensuring a more accurate, objective analysis. Enhancing your comparison of GAD-7 vs MAST is only a few clicks away with Harmony. Simply select the instruments, either from Harmony's database or you can upload your own instruments in PDF form into Harmony's web interface. Harmony's ability to compare items in multiple languages further widens its application. With clearer insights, Harmony opens new doors to understanding and using the results of the GAD-7 vs MAST comparison to advance psychology research.

## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
